unnormalised: Diwali, the festival of lights, is just around the corner, guys! Mark your calendars 'cause it's happening on 01/11/2024. Time to start prepping those diyas and mithai!
normalised: Diwali, the festival of lights, is just around the corner, guys! Mark your calendars 'cause it's happening on first november two thousand and twenty four. Time to start prepping those diyas and mithai!

unnormalised: But wait, there's more! The Chhath Puja celebrations will kick off around 07:30 AM on 07/11/2024, right after Diwali. Get ready for those early morning rituals by the river, folks! It's a truly beautiful sight.
normalised: But wait, there's more! The Chhath Puja celebrations will kick off around seven thirty A-M on seventh november two thousand and twenty four, right after Diwali. Get ready for those early morning rituals by the river, folks! It's a truly beautiful sight.

unnormalised: And before you know it, Christmas will be knocking on our doors. Expect those carols and festive decorations to start popping up around 12/20/2024, leading up to the big day on 25/12/2024. Time to break out the Santa hats!
normalised: And before you know it, Christmas will be knocking on our doors. Expect those carols and festive decorations to start popping up around twentieth december two thousand and twenty four, leading up to the big day on twenty fifth december two thousand and twenty four. Time to break out the Santa hats!

unnormalised: New Year's Eve, the grand finale of the year, is on 31/12/2024. Parties will probably start ramping up at 8:00 PM, continuing way past midnight. Prepare for some serious celebrating!
normalised: New Year's Eve, the grand finale of the year, is on thirty first december two thousand and twenty four. Parties will probably start ramping up at eight zero zero P-M, continuing way past midnight. Prepare for some serious celebrating!

unnormalised: Lohri celebrations will start around 05:00 PM on 13/01/2025. It's a perfect chance to light a bonfire and celebrate with family & friends. Do not forget to stock up on peanuts and gajak!
normalised: Lohri celebrations will start around five zero zero P-M on thirteenth january two thousand and twenty five. It's a perfect chance to light a bonfire and celebrate with family and friends. Do not forget to stock up on peanuts and gajak!

unnormalised: Makara Sankranti will be celebrated on 14/01/2025. Flying kites from rooftops, and preparing sweet pongal are some of the many ways in which Makara Sankranti is celebrated.
normalised: Makara Sankranti will be celebrated on fourteenth january two thousand and twenty five. Flying kites from rooftops, and preparing sweet pongal are some of the many ways in which Makara Sankranti is celebrated.

unnormalised: And finally, don't forget about Republic Day on 26/01/2025. You'll probably see the parade on TV starting at 9:00 AM. It's a proud day for every Indian! So many awesome festivals coming up! Get ready to party!
normalised: And finally, don't forget about Republic Day on twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty five. You'll probably see the parade on T-V starting at nine zero zero A-M. It's a proud day for every Indian! So many awesome festivals coming up! Get ready to party!
